bill.title: RELATING TO OPIOIDS.
bill.abstract: Requires the inclusion of a label warning of the risks of addiction and death on the packaging of any opioid drug dispensed by a health care professional or pharmacist. (HB1602 CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO NON-GENERAL FUNDS.
bill.abstract: Abolishes various non-general funds and accounts of the Department of Taxation and transfers the unencumbered balances to the general fund. (HB1652 CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO CONDOMINIUMS.
bill.abstract: Clarifies the process, including payment obligations, mediation requirements, and triggers for further default, where a condominium unit owner and association reach a payment plan to resolve a nonjudicial foreclosure. Establishes procedures that provide condominium owners with the right to submit disputed legal fees, penalties or fines, late fees, lien filing fees, or other charges, except for common expense assessments, to the mediation process prior to payment. Sunsets on 6/30/2020. (HB1873 CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO HEALTH.
bill.abstract: Establishes positions and appropriates funds to assist in the review, certification, and recertification of dialysis centers and other health care facilities under the purview of the Department of Health. Establishes the Electronic Smoking Device Retailer Registration Unit within the Department of the Attorney General. Requires retailers of electronic smoking devices to register with the unit. Declares that sales of cigarettes, tobacco products, and electronic smoking devices are a statewide concern. Restricts locations where retailers may display cigarettes and tobacco products. Requires that retailers of tobacco products and electronic smoking devices check the identification of tobacco or electronic smoking device purchasers. Makes it unlawful for a person under the age of 21 to possess ...

profile.pname: Astellas|Healthcare General|Change in Reimbursement for Medicaid

bill.title: RELATING TO MEDICATION SYNCHRONIZATION.
bill.abstract: Allows the synchronization of plan participants' medications. Requires plans, policies, contracts, or agreements that are offered by health insurers, mutual benefit societies, and health maintenance organizations and provide prescription drug benefits, to apply prorated daily cost-sharing rates for prescriptions dispensed by network pharmacies for less than a thirty-day supply. (HB2145 CD1)

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: RELATING TO MARINE EVENTS.
bill.abstract: Requires the Department of Land and Natural Resources to allow applications for marine event permits up to one year in advance and authorizes the Department to adopt rules to mitigate hazards posed by vessels, thrill craft, drones, and other means used by spectators to observe or record marine events. Requires a report to the 2019 Legislature. (HB2259 CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO THE UNIFORM CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES ACT.
bill.abstract: Updates Uniform Controlled Substances Act for consistency with federal law. Allows prescription of drugs to patients undergoing medically managed withdrawal, also known as detoxification treatment and maintenance treatment, by practitioners who are properly registered. (SD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO OPIOID ANTAGONISTS.
bill.abstract: Authorizes pharmacists to prescribe, dispense, and provide related education on opioid antagonists to individuals at risk of opioid overdose and to family members and caregivers of individuals at risk of opioid overdose without the need for a written, approved collaborative agreement; subject to certain conditions. (CD1)

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: An Act to increase renewable energy and reduce high-cost peak hours
bill.abstract: December 31, 2019, and by .75 percent per year each year after until December 31, 2050.Further, the bill requires the department to conduct a study on the impact of the renewable portfolio standard and the clean peak standard on emissions, reliability and resiliency; requires submission of an initial report by December 31, 3030, an addition review and report every five years thereafter. Establishes a clean capacity credit value program, which provides a fixed price credit received for each MWh of energy or reserves provided during a Seasonal Peak Period that represents a compliance mechanism that makes no claim on other attributes; qualifies clean peak resources for the value for between 10 and 20 years from its effective date; prohibits electric distribution companies from owning clean ...

bill.title: An Act promoting climate change adaptation, environmental and natural resource protection, and investment in recreational assets and opportunity
bill.abstract: ...Comprising 92 pages, this bill also includes 85 outside sections in addition to the appropriations. The outside sections make a large number of technical changes, many of them dealing with the consolidation of civil penalties, and changes relative to a large number of environmental and aquaculture laws. Additionally, the outside sections establish new programs for several environmental initiatives, including coordination of efforts in preparation for impacts of climate change and mitigation of damage from extreme weather events new programs and transfer of development rights in preservation areas. Finally, the outside sections provide for bonding in appropriate amounts.\rNew draft of HB4599, the original House response to the Governor\'s Environmental Bond Bill. This bill includes proposed ...

bill.title: An Act relative to economic development in the commonwealth
bill.abstract: ... Chapter 176W entitled Corporate Governance Annual Disclosure, that applies exclusively to insurers and insurance groups. Every insurer or insurance group would be filed to require a Corporate Governance Annual Disclosure, a confidential report filed in accordance with requirements set forth by the Commissioner of Insurance. Documents, materials or other information in the possession or control of the Division are to be proprietary and recognized to contain trade secrets.\r\rNew draft of HB4592. The new draft makes technical and grammatical corrections. In addition the new text adds additional requirements to the apprentice tax credit (such as that the primary place of employment of the apprentice must be in the Commonwealth), limiting the aggregate amount of the apprentice tax credit to ...

bill.title: An Act for prevention and access to appropriate care and treatment of addiction
bill.abstract: ...This bill is intended to improve the availability of substance use disorder treatment, by expanding the range of medical professionals authorized to perform the evaluation and by requiring that the emergency department affirmatively connect the patient with the appropriate level of care. The bill also permits medical professionals or police officers to authorize the transport of a patient to a substance use treatment facility for emergency assessment and treatment when the patient presents a risk of serious harm due to addiction and the patient will not agree to voluntary treatment. Additionally, the bill increases access to the overdose drug naloxone by guaranteeing that practitioners who prescribe and pharmacists who dispense naloxone in good faith will be protected from criminal or ...

bill.title: An Act relative to economic development in the commonwealth
bill.abstract: Massachusetts Growth Capital Corporation. Additional appropriations added during House floor debate include 116,975,000 for municipal public infrastructure grants, and another $8,840,000 for local economic development projects. (Please note that together these two new line-items include almost 120 earmarks as part of the inside language.)\r\rIn the outside sections, among other things, the bill increases the maximum amount of refundable tax credits which may be granted to a project by the EACC from $5,000,000 to $7,500,000; exempts refundable tax credits granted to projects designated as extraordinary economic development opportunities from the maximum credit cap; allows EACC to grant additional credits in excess of existing caps for certified projects designated as extraordinary economic ...

status.statusval: Referred to Senate Committee on Bonding, Capital Expenditures and State Assets

bill.title: An Act relative to solar power in environmental justice and urban communities
bill.abstract: Establishes a framework for the allocation of solar energy market net metering credits for low-income and Environmental Justice households; defines low-income households under GL 40T, related to publicly assisted affordable housing; defines environmental justice households as those with an annual median household income equal to or less than 65 percent of the statewide median, or whose population is up to 25 percent minority or lacking English language proficiency; allows low-income and environmental justice households to take the same market net metering credits as municipal or governmental entities; allows low-income solar net metering facilities to receive credits, and exempts them from demand side management and renewable energy kilowatt-hour charges; increases aggregate net metering ...

status.statusval: Senate Session SS - 07/12/2018 11:00 AM Gardner Auditorium

bill.title: An Act to increase container recycling in the Commonwealth
bill.abstract: Secretary of Environmental Affairs to establish a process for determining the diversion rate and the redemption rate. If, by December 31, 2023, the mean diversion rate for any two year period is found by EOEA to be equal to or greater than the mean redemption rate in the corresponding two year period, then this section is to be repealed automatically.

bill.title: An Act relative to marijuana-related revenue in the town of Millbury
bill.abstract: Storm Water Improvements Stabilization Fund. If there is no allocation into the Road Infrastructure Stabilization Fund or an allocation of less than 50%, then the amount otherwise allocable to the Road Infrastructure Stabilization Fund is to be allocated, in equal amounts, to the Other Post-Employment Benefits Stabilization Fund, the Unfunded Retirement Liability Stabilization Fund and the Capital Projects Stabilization Fund.

bill.title: Economic development; brownfield redevelopment authority; definition of demolition within the brownfield redevelopment financing act; modify. Amends sec. 2 of 1996 PA 381 (MCL 125.2652).
bill.abstract: AN ACT to amend 1996 PA 381, entitled ""An act to authorize municipalities to create a brownfield redevelopment authority to facilitate the implementation of brownfield plans; to create brownfield redevelopment zones; to promote the revitalization, redevelopment, and reuse of certain property, including, but not limited to, tax reverted, blighted, or functionally obsolete property; to prescribe the powers and duties of brownfield redevelopment authorities; to permit the issuance of bonds and other evidences of indebtedness by an authority; to authorize the acquisition and disposal of certain property; to authorize certain funds; to prescribe certain powers and duties of certain state officers and agencies; and to authorize and permit the use of certain tax increment financing,"" by amending ...
